info.title: Twilio SendGrid Statistics API
info.summary: The Twilio SendGrid Statistics API allows you to retrieve the various statistics related to your email program.
info.description:
The Twilio SendGrid Statistics API allows you to retrieve the various statistics related to your email program.

Tracking your emails is an important part of being a good sender and learning about how your users interact with your email. This includes everything from clicks and opens to looking at which browsers and mailbox providers your customers use.

SendGrid has broken up statistics in specific ways so that you can get at-a-glance data, as well as the details of how your email is being used.

Category statistics are available for the previous thirteen months only.

See [**Statistics Overview**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview) for more information.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by browser type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).

parameters.name: browsers
parameters.description: The browsers to get statistics for. You can include up to 10 different browsers by including this parameter multiple times.

date.description: The date that the statistics were gathered.

name.description: The name of the specific segmentation.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a paginated list of all of your categories.**

You can use the `limit` query parameter to set the page size. If your list contains more items than the page size permits, you can make multiple requests. Use the `offset` query parameter to control the position in the list from which to start retrieving additional items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: `limit` sets the page size, i.e. maximum number of items from the list to be returned for a single API request. If omitted, the default page size is used.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Allows you to perform a prefix search on this particular category.

category.description: A category used to group emails by broad topic.

message.description: A message explaining why your categories could not be retrieved.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your email statistics for each of your categories.**

If you do not define any query parameters, this endpoint will return a sum for each category in groups of 10.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: The individual categories that you want to retrieve statistics for. You may include up to 10 different categories.

parameters.name: aggregated_by
parameters.description: How to group the statistics. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".

get.summary: Retrieve sums of email stats for each category.
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the total sum of each email statistic for every category over the given date range.**

If you do not define any query parameters, this endpoint will return a sum for each category in groups of 10.

parameters.name: sort_by_metric
parameters.description: The metric that you want to sort by.  Must be a single metric.

parameters.name: sort_by_direction
parameters.description: The direction you want to sort.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The point in the list to begin retrieving results.

parameters.name: aggregated_by
parameters.description: How to group the statistics. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".

get.summary: Retrieve email statistics by client type.
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by client type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).

date.description: The date that the statistics were gathered.

name.description: The name of the specific segmentation.

parameters.name: client_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of client to retrieve stats for. Must be either "phone", "tablet", "webmail", or "desktop".

get.summary: Retrieve stats by a specific client type.
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by a specific client type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

### Available Client Types
- phone
- tablet
- webmail
- desktop

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).

date.description: The date that the statistics were gathered.

name.description: The name of the specific segmentation.

get.summary: Retrieve email statistics by device type.
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by the device type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

## Available Device Types
| **Device** | **Description** | **Example** |
|---|---|---|
| Desktop | Email software on desktop computer. | I.E., Outlook, Sparrow, or Apple Mail. |
| Webmail |	A web-based email client. | I.E., Yahoo, Google, AOL, or Outlook.com. |
| Phone | A smart phone. | iPhone, Android, Blackberry, etc.
| Tablet | A tablet computer. | iPad, android based tablet, etc. |
| Other | An unrecognized device. |

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).

date.description: The date that the statistics were gathered.

name.description: The name of the specific segmentation.

get.summary: Retrieve email statistics by country and state/province.
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by country and state/province.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [User Guide](https://wwww.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview).

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country you would like to see statistics for. Currently only supported for US and CA.

date.description: The date that the statistics were gathered.

name.description: The name of the specific segmentation.

get.summary: Retrieve email statistics by mailbox provider.
get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by recipient mailbox provider.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).

parameters.name: mailbox_providers
parameters.description: The mail box providers to get statistics for. You can include up to 10 by including this parameter multiple times.

date.description: The date that the statistics were gathered.

name.description: The name of the specific segmentation.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your global email statistics between a given date range.**

Parent accounts can see either aggregated stats for the parent account or aggregated stats for a subuser specified in the `on-behalf-of` header. Subuser accounts will see only their own stats.

date.description: The date the stats were gathered.

AdvancedStatsClicks.title: Stats: Advanced Stats with Clicks
AdvancedStatsClicks.description: The individual events and their stats.

clicks.description: The number of links that were clicked in your emails.

unique_clicks.description: The number of unique recipients who clicked links in your emails.

AdvancedStatsOpens.title: Stats: Advanced Stats with Opens
AdvancedStatsOpens.description: The individual events and their stats.

opens.description: The total number of times your emails were opened by recipients.

unique_opens.description: The number of unique recipients who opened your emails.

AdvancedStatsMailboxProvider.title: Stats: Advanced Stats for Mailbox Provider
AdvancedStatsMailboxProvider.description: The individual events and their stats.

blocks.description: The number of emails that were not allowed to be delivered by ISPs.

bounces.description: The number of emails that bounced instead of being delivered.

deferred.description: The number of emails that temporarily could not be delivered.

delivered.description: The number of emails SendGrid was able to confirm were actually delivered to a recipient.

drops.description: The number of emails that were not delivered due to the recipient email address being on a suppression list.

requests.description: The number of emails that were requested to be delivered.

processed.description: Requests from your website, application, or mail client via SMTP Relay or the Web API that SendGrid processed.

spam_reports.description: The number of recipients who marked your email as spam.

date.description: The date the statistics were gathered.

blocks.description: The number of emails that were not allowed to be delivered by ISPs.

bounce_drops.description: The number of emails that were dropped because of a bounce.

bounces.description: The number of emails that bounced instead of being delivered.

clicks.description: The number of links that were clicked.

deferred.description: The number of emails that temporarily could not be delivered.

delivered.description: The number of emails SendGrid was able to confirm were actually delivered to a recipient.

invalid_emails.description: The number of recipients who had malformed email addresses or whose mail provider reported the address as invalid.

opens.description: The total number of times your emails were opened by recipients.

processed.description: Requests from your website, application, or mail client via SMTP Relay or the API that SendGrid processed.

requests.description: The number of emails that were requested to be delivered.

spam_report_drops.description: The number of emails that were dropped due to a recipient previously marking your emails as spam.

spam_reports.description: The number of recipients who marked your email as spam.

unique_clicks.description: The number of unique recipients who clicked links in your emails.

unique_opens.description: The number of unique recipients who opened your emails.

unsubscribe_drops.description: The number of emails dropped due to a recipient unsubscribing from your emails.

unsubscribes.description: The number of recipients who unsubscribed from your emails.

type.description: How you are segmenting your statistics.

PaginationCommonOffset.name: offset
PaginationCommonOffset.description: The number of items in the list to skip over before starting to retrieve the items for the requested page. The default `offset` of `0` represents the beginning of the list, i.e. the start of the first page. To request the second page of the list, set the `offset` to the page size as determined by `limit`. Use multiples of the page size as your `offset` to request further consecutive pages. E.g. assume your page size is set to `10`. An `offset` of `10` requests the second page, an `offset` of `20` requests the third page and so on, provided there are sufficiently many items in your list.

StatsAdvancedStatsBaseQueryStringsStartD.name: start_date
StatsAdvancedStatsBaseQueryStringsStartD.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

StatsAdvancedStatsBaseQueryStringsEndDat.name: end_date
StatsAdvancedStatsBaseQueryStringsEndDat.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

StatsAdvancedStatsBaseQueryStringsAggreg.name: aggregated_by
StatsAdvancedStatsBaseQueryStringsAggreg.description: How to group the statistics. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".

StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetLimi.name: limit
StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetLimi.description: The number of results to return.

StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetOffs.name: offset
StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetOffs.description: The point in the list to begin retrieving results.

StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetAggr.name: aggregated_by
StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetAggr.description: How to group the statistics. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".

StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetStar.name: start_date
StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetStar.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetEndD.name: end_date
StatsAdvancedQueryStringsLimitOffsetEndD.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

OnBehalfOf.name: on-behalf-of
OnBehalfOf.description: The `on-behalf-of` header allows you to make API calls from a parent account on behalf of the parent's Subusers or customer accounts. You will use the parent account's API key when using this header. When making a call on behalf of a customer account, the property value should be "account-id" followed by the customer account's ID (e.g., `on-behalf-of: account-id <account-id>`). When making a call on behalf of a Subuser, the property value should be the Subuser's username (e.g., `on-behalf-of: <subuser-username>`). See [**On Behalf Of**](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/on-behalf-of) for more information.

BearerAuth.description: Twilio SendGrid requires you to authenticate with its APIs using an API key. The API key must be sent as a bearer token in the Authorization header.
